properties.name: open
properties.description: Indicates whether or not the alert is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

properties.name: closable
properties.description: Makes the alert closable.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: The alert's variant.

properties.name: duration
properties.description:
The length of time, in milliseconds, the alert will show before closing itself. If the user interacts with
the alert before it closes (e.g. moves the mouse over it), the timer will restart. Defaults to `Infinity`.

properties.name: show
properties.description: Shows the alert.

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Hides the alert

properties.name: toast
properties.description:
Displays the alert as a toast notification. This will move the alert out of its position in the DOM and, when
dismissed, it will be removed from the DOM completely. By storing a reference to the alert, you can reuse it by
calling this method again. The returned promise will resolve after the alert is hidden.

events.name: sl-show
events.description: Emitted when the alert opens.

events.name: sl-after-show
events.description: Emitted after the alert opens and all animations are complete.

events.name: sl-hide
events.description: Emitted when the alert closes.

events.name: sl-after-hide
events.description: Emitted after the alert closes and all animations are complete.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the built-in animation to use. For custom animations, use the `keyframes` prop.

properties.name: play
properties.description:
Plays the animation. When omitted, the animation will be paused. This prop will be automatically removed when the
animation finishes or gets canceled.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: Determines the direction of playback as well as the behavior when reaching the end of an iteration.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.

properties.name: easing
properties.description:
The easing function to use for the animation. This can be a Shoelace easing function or a custom easing function
such as `cubic-bezier(0, 1, .76, 1.14)`.

properties.name: endDelay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the active period of an animation sequence.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Sets how the animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

properties.name: iterations
properties.description: The number of iterations to run before the animation completes. Defaults to `Infinity`, which loops.

properties.name: iterationStart
properties.description: The offset at which to start the animation, usually between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

properties.name: keyframes
properties.description: The keyframes to use for the animation. If this is set, `name` will be ignored.

properties.name: playbackRate
properties.description:
Sets the animation's playback rate. The default is `1`, which plays the animation at a normal speed. Setting this
to `2`, for example, will double the animation's speed. A negative value can be used to reverse the animation. This
value can be changed without causing the animation to restart.

properties.name: currentTime
properties.description: Gets and sets the current animation time.

properties.name: cancel
properties.description: Clears all KeyframeEffects caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

properties.name: finish
properties.description: Sets the playback time to the end of the animation corresponding to the current playback direction.

events.name: sl-cancel
events.description: Emitted when the animation is canceled.

events.name: sl-finish
events.description: Emitted when the animation finishes.

events.name: sl-start
events.description: Emitted when the animation starts or restarts.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of button. When the type is `submit`, the button will submit the surrounding form. Note that the default
value is `button` instead of `submit`, which is opposite of how native `<button>` elements behave.

properties.name: download
properties.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is set.

properties.name: form
properties.description:
The "form owner" to associate the button with. If omitted, the closest containing form will be used instead. The
value of this attribute must be an id of a form in the same document or shadow root as the button.

properties.description: Used to override the form owner's `method` attribute.

properties.name: formNoValidate

properties.name: formTarget

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the HTML form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the HTML form control. Primarily used to differentiate a list of related checkboxes that have the same name.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the checkbox (so the user can't check / uncheck it).

properties.name: required
properties.description: Makes the checkbox a required field.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: Draws the checkbox in a checked state.

properties.name: indeterminate
properties.description: Draws the checkbox in an indeterminate state. Usually applies to a checkbox that represents "select all" or "select none" when the items to which it applies are a mix of selected and unselected.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by the `required` prop.

properties.name: defaultChecked
properties.description: Gets or sets the default value used to reset this element. The initial value corresponds to the one originally specified in the HTML that created this element.

properties.name: click
properties.description: Simulates a click on the checkbox.

properties.name: focus
properties.description: Sets focus on the checkbox.

properties.name: blur
properties.description: Removes focus from the checkbox.

properties.name: reportValidity
properties.description: Checks for validity and shows the browser's validation message if the control is invalid.

properties.name: setCustomValidity
properties.description: Sets a custom validation message. If `message` is not empty, the field will be considered invalid.

events.name: sl-blur
events.description: Emitted when the control loses focus.

events.name: sl-change
events.description: Emitted when the control's checked state changes.

events.name: sl-focus
events.description: Emitted when the control gains focus.

display HTML, you can use the `label` slot` instead.

properties.name: format
properties.description:
The format to use for the display value. If opacity is enabled, these will translate to HEXA, RGBA, and HSLA
respectively. The color picker will always accept user input in any format (including CSS color names) and convert
it to the desired format.

properties.name: inline
properties.description: Renders the color picker inline rather than inside a dropdown.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Determines the size of the color picker's trigger. This has no effect on inline color pickers.

properties.name: noFormatToggle
properties.description: Removes the format toggle.

properties.description: The input's name attribute.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the color picker.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description:
This will be true when the control is in an invalid state. Validity is determined by the `setCustomValidity()`
method using the browser's constraint validation API.

properties.name: hoist
properties.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: Whether to show the opacity slider.

properties.name: uppercase
properties.description: By default, the value will be set in lowercase. Set this to true to set it in uppercase instead.

properties.name: swatches
properties.description:
An array of predefined color swatches to display. Can include any format the color picker can parse, including
HEX(A), RGB(A), HSL(A), and CSS color names.

properties.name: getFormattedValue
properties.description: Returns the current value as a string in the specified format.

properties.description: Checks for validity and shows the browser's validation message if the control is invalid.

properties.name: setCustomValidity
properties.description: Sets a custom validation message. If `message` is not empty, the field will be considered invalid.

properties.name: typeToSelect
properties.description:
Initiates type-to-select logic, which automatically selects an option based on what the user is currently typing.
The event passed will be used to append the appropriate characters to the internal query and the selection will be
updated. After a brief period, the internal query is cleared automatically. This is useful for enabling
type-to-select behavior when the menu doesn't have focus.

events.name: sl-select
events.description: Emitted when a menu item is selected.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: Draws the item in a checked state.

properties.name: value
properties.description: A unique value to store in the menu item. This can be used as a way to identify menu items when selected.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Draws the menu item in a disabled state.

properties.name: getTextLabel
properties.description: Returns a text label based on the contents of the menu item's default slot.

events.name: sl-label-change
events.description: Emitted when the menu item's text label changes. For performance reasons, this event is only emitted if the default slot's `slotchange` event is triggered. It will not fire when the label is first set.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Draws the item in a checked state.

attributes.description: A unique value to store in the menu item. This can be used as a way to identify menu items when selected.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Draws the menu item in a disabled state.

properties.description: Indicates whether or not the previous value of the node's text should be recorded.

properties.description: Watches for the addition or removal of new child nodes.

properties.name: popup
properties.description: A reference to the internal popup container. Useful for animating and styling the popup with JavaScript.

properties.name: anchor
properties.description:
The element the popup will be anchored to. If the anchor lives outside of the popup, you can provide its `id` or a
reference to it here. If the anchor lives inside the popup, use the `anchor` slot instead.

properties.name: active
properties.description:
Activates the positioning logic and shows the popup. When this attribute is removed, the positioning logic is torn
down and the popup will be hidden.

properties.name: placement
properties.description:
The preferred placement of the popup. Note that the actual placement will vary as configured to keep the
panel inside of the viewport.

properties.name: strategy
properties.description:
Determines how the popup is positioned. The `absolute` strategy works well in most cases, but if
overflow is clipped, using a `fixed` position strategy can often workaround it.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its anchor.

properties.name: skidding
properties.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its anchor.

properties.name: arrow
properties.description:
Attaches an arrow to the popup. The arrow's size and color can be customized using the `--arrow-size` and
`--arrow-color` custom properties. For additional customizations, you can also target the arrow using
`::part(arrow)` in your stylesheet.

properties.name: arrowPlacement
properties.description:
The placement of the arrow. The default is `anchor`, which will align the arrow as close to the center of the
anchor as possible, considering available space and `arrow-padding`. A value of `start`, `end`, or `center` will
align the arrow to the start, end, or center of the popover instead.

properties.name: arrowPadding
properties.description:
The amount of padding between the arrow and the edges of the popup. If the popup has a border-radius, for example,
this will prevent it from overflowing the corners.

properties.name: flip
properties.description:
When set, placement of the popup will flip to the opposite site to keep it in view. You can use
`flipFallbackPlacements` to further configure how the fallback placement is determined.

properties.name: flipFallbackPlacements
properties.description:
If the preferred placement doesn't fit, popup will be tested in these fallback placements until one fits. Must be a
string of any number of placements separated by a space, e.g. "top bottom left". If no placement fits, the flip
fallback strategy will be used instead.

properties.name: flipFallbackStrategy
properties.description:
When neither the preferred placement nor the fallback placements fit, this value will be used to determine whether
the popup should be positioned as it was initially preferred or using the best available fit based on available
space.

properties.name: flipBoundary
properties.description:
The flip boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when flipping. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

properties.name: flipPadding
properties.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the flip behavior will occur.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: Moves the popup along the axis to keep it in view when clipped.

properties.name: shiftBoundary
properties.description:
The shift boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when shifting. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

properties.name: shiftPadding
properties.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the shift behavior will occur.

properties.name: autoSize
properties.description: When set, this will cause the popup to automatically resize itself to prevent it from overflowing.

properties.name: sync
properties.description: Syncs the popup's width or height to that of the anchor element.

properties.name: autoSizeBoundary
properties.description:
The auto-size boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when resizing. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

properties.name: autoSizePadding
properties.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the auto-size behavior will occur.

properties.name: reposition
properties.description: Recalculate and repositions the popup.

events.name: sl-reposition
events.description: Emitted when the popup is repositioned. This event can fire a lot, so avoid putting expensive operations in your listener or consider debouncing it.

primary panel is designated, it will maintain its size and the other panel will grow or shrink as needed when the
host element is resized.

`"100px 50%"`.

properties.description: How close the divider must be to a snap point until snapping occurs.
